name: cpgplot
description: Identify and plot CpG islands in nucleotide sequence(s)

options.description: Nucleotide sequence(s) filename and optional format, or reference (input USA)

[100] The percentage CG content and the Observed frequency of CG is calculated within a window whose size is set by this parameter. The window is moved down the sequence and these statistics are calculated at each position that the window is moved to. (Integer 1 or more)
[200] This sets the minimum length that a CpG island has to be before it is reported. (Integer 1 or more)
[0.6] This sets the minimum average observed to expected ratio of C plus G to CpG in a set of 10 windows that are required before a CpG island is reported. (Number from 0.000 to 10.000)
[50.] This sets the minimum average percentage of G plus C a set of 10 windows that are required before a CpG island is reported. (Number from 0.000 to 100.000)
[*.cpgplot] This sets the name of the file holding the report of the input sequence name, CpG island parameters and the output details of any CpG islands that are found.
[$EMBOSS_GRAPHICS value, or png] Graph type (ps, hpgl, hp7470, hp7580, meta, cps, tek, tekt, none, data, png, gif, svg)
If this is set to true then the graph of the observed to expected ratio of C plus G to CpG within a window is displayed.
If this is set to true then the graph of the observed to expected ratio of C plus G to CpG within a window is displayed.
If this is set to true then the graph of the regions which have been determined to be CpG islands is displayed.
If this is set to true then the graph of the regions which have been determined to be CpG islands is displayed.
If this is set to true then the graph of the percentage C plus G within a window is displayed.
If this is set to true then the graph of the percentage C plus G within a window is displayed.
Report command line options and exit. More information on associated and general qualifiers can be found with -help -verbose
